author: Joshua Robinson
title: Cycling Wonders What to Do About Chris Froome
text:
AIGLE, Switzerland—David Lappartient was barely an hour into his job presiding over cycling’s world governing body when his phone rang with a crisis. Chris Froome, the four-time Tour de France champion and one of cycling’s most famous names, had failed a doping control.
He turned to his wife, who had heard him curse under his breath. “I’ve already got trouble on the way,” he said. Lappartient hadn’t even visited his new office.
That...
